page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY-LITTLE EASTON
page.content: {Little Easton}is a small village with 113 houses,many of these used to belong to the{Maynard}Estates.The Maynards came here after the Norman Conquest,the family still own alot of the land.We visited Little Easton {Manor}which is owned by the Pedley family who have a furniture business in Saffron Walden.We spoke to Mr Frank Baker and Mr Alan Pryer who were born in the village.Mr Baker used to work for the Maynards at the brickworks which has now closed down.The shop and post office have closed and Tradesmen no longer call.People go outside the village for shopping and entertainment Mr Pryer's father worked for the Countess of Warrick as a carpenter,he also carved the altar and choir stalls at the church.We visited The Stag,it has been a pub for many years,it is an essential community meeting place.
